notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities, such as:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Minimize network exposure for all control system devices and/or systems, ensuring they are not accessible from the internet.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Locate control system networks and remote devices behind firewalls and isolating them from business networks.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: When remote access is required, use more secure methods, such as Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), recognizing VPNs may have vulnerabilities and should be updated to the most current version available. Also recognize VPN is only as secure as the connected devices.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

document.title: Rockwell Automation AADvance Trusted SIS Workstation

product.name: Rockwell Automation AADvance Trusted SIS Workstation: <=2.00.01

notes.text: A vulnerability exists which could allow remote threat actors to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of 7-Zip. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability because the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specific vulnerability exists in the analysis of 7Z files. The problem results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can lead to an integer underflow before writing to memory. A threat actor can exploit this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Rockwell Automation offers users the following solutions:
AADvance Trusted SIS Workstation: Update to version 2.00.02 or later
Customers using the affected software, who are not able to upgrade to the corrected version, are encouraged to apply security best practices, where possible.
Rockwell Automation Customers using the affected software are encouraged to apply the following additional risk mitigations, if possible:
Do not archive or restore projects from unknown sources.

For information on how to mitigate Security Risks on industrial automation control systems, we encourage customers to implement our suggested security best practices to minimize the risk of the vulnerability.
For more information about this issue, please see the advisory on the Rockwell Automation security page.

notes.text: A SquashFS File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution exists in 7-Zip that allows remote threat actors to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of 7-Zip. User interaction is also required to exploit this vulnerability, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specific vulnerability arises during the analysis of SQFS files due to the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data. This can cause a write operation to exceed the end of an allocated buffer. A threat actor can exploit this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process.
